text: curl is a remarkably powerful command-line tool for squeezing things out of web servers.
I can't say about RapidShare in particular, but if you see what the manual download is doing, you can get curl to post the same forms, for example.
You have to point it to a file containing the cookie corresponding to your Rapidshare account (e.g.
the cookies.txt in Firefox's profile directory).

Here's a tutorial for a command line tool to download from rapidshare:
http://fedoracoreproject.blogspot.com/2009/03/linux-command-line-tool-to-download.html
It let's you (depending on file hosting)
To get urllib2 to open https URLs you need Python with SSL support.
How to get it depends on your distribution.
Nice commandline tool for RapidShare and many other services (MegaUploads, HotFiles etc).
It allows simultanous transfer from different services:

Just create file with list of URLs (# for comment), and start rsget.pl list-of-urls
